segment.source: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups
segment.target: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups

segment.source: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups
segment.target: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups

segment.source: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups
segment.target: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups

segment.source: Starting in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 SP3, you can add optional packages to your connection groups to simplify connection group management.
segment.target: Starting in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 SP3, you can add optional packages to your connection groups to simplify connection group management.

segment.source: The following table summarizes the tasks that you can complete more easily by using optional packages, and provides links to instructions for each task.
segment.target: The following table summarizes the tasks that you can complete more easily by using optional packages, and provides links to instructions for each task.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Optional packages are supported only in App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: Optional packages are supported only in App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: Before using optional packages, see Requirements for using optional packages in connection groups.
segment.target: Before using optional packages, see Requirements for using optional packages in connection groups.

segment.source: Link to instructions
segment.target: Link to instructions

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Use one connection group, with optional packages, for multiple users who have different packages entitled to them
segment.target: Use one connection group, with optional packages, for multiple users who have different packages entitled to them

segment.source: Use a single connection group to make different groups of applications and plug-ins available to different end users.
segment.target: Use a single connection group to make different groups of applications and plug-ins available to different end users.

segment.source: For example, you want to distribute Microsoft Office to all end users, but distribute different plug-ins to different subsets of users.
segment.target: For example, you want to distribute Microsoft Office to all end users, but distribute different plug-ins to different subsets of users.

segment.source: Unpublish or delete an optional package, or unpublish an optional package and republish it later, without changing the connection group
segment.target: Unpublish or delete an optional package, or unpublish an optional package and republish it later, without changing the connection group

segment.source: Unpublish, delete, or republish an optional package without having to disable, remove, edit, add, and re-enable the connection group on the App-V Client.
segment.target: Unpublish, delete, or republish an optional package without having to disable, remove, edit, add, and re-enable the connection group on the App-V Client.

segment.source: You can also unpublish the optional package and republish it later without having to disable or republish the connection group.
segment.target: You can also unpublish the optional package and republish it later without having to disable or republish the connection group.

segment.source: Use one connection group, with optional packages, for multiple users with different packages entitled to them
segment.target: Use one connection group, with optional packages, for multiple users with different packages entitled to them

segment.source: Task description
segment.target: Task description

segment.source: How to perform the task
segment.target: How to perform the task

segment.source: With App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: With App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: You can add optional packages to connection groups, which enables you to provide different combinations of applications and plug-ins to different end users.
segment.target: You can add optional packages to connection groups, which enables you to provide different combinations of applications and plug-ins to different end users.

segment.source: Example: You want to distribute Microsoft Office to your end users, but enable a certain plug-in for only a subset of users.
segment.target: Example: You want to distribute Microsoft Office to your end users, but enable a certain plug-in for only a subset of users.

segment.source: To do this, create a connection group that contains a package with Office, and another package with Office plug-ins, and then make the plug-ins package optional.
segment.target: To do this, create a connection group that contains a package with Office, and another package with Office plug-ins, and then make the plug-ins package optional.

segment.source: End users who are not entitled to the plug-in package will still be able to run Office.
segment.target: End users who are not entitled to the plug-in package will still be able to run Office.

segment.source: Method
segment.target: Method

segment.source: Steps
segment.target: Steps

segment.source: App-V Server – Management Console
segment.target: App-V Server – Management Console

segment.source: In the Management Console, select PACKAGES to open the PACKAGES page.
segment.target: In the Management Console, select PACKAGES to open the PACKAGES page.

segment.source: Select CONNECTION GROUPS to display the Connection Groups library.
segment.target: Select CONNECTION GROUPS to display the Connection Groups library.

segment.source: Select the correct connection group from the Connection Groups library.
segment.target: Select the correct connection group from the Connection Groups library.

segment.source: Click EDIT in the CONNECTED PACKAGES pane.
segment.target: Click EDIT in the CONNECTED PACKAGES pane.

segment.source: Select Optional next to the package name.
segment.target: Select Optional next to the package name.

segment.source: Select the ADD PACKAGE ACCESS TO GROUP ACCESS check box.
segment.target: Select the ADD PACKAGE ACCESS TO GROUP ACCESS check box.

segment.source: This required step adds to the connection group the package entitlements that you configured earlier when you assigned packages to Active Directory groups.
segment.target: This required step adds to the connection group the package entitlements that you configured earlier when you assigned packages to Active Directory groups.

segment.source: App-V Server - PowerShell cmdlet
segment.target: App-V Server - PowerShell cmdlet

segment.source: Use the following cmdlet, and specify the -Optional parameter:
segment.target: Use the following cmdlet, and specify the -Optional parameter:

segment.source: Add-AppvServerConnectionGroupPackage
segment.target: Add-AppvServerConnectionGroupPackage

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: App-V Client on a Stand-alone computer
segment.target: App-V Client on a Stand-alone computer

segment.source: Create the connection group XML document, and set the Package tag attribute IsOptional to “true”.
segment.target: Create the connection group XML document, and set the Package tag attribute IsOptional to “true”.

segment.source: Use the following cmdlets to add and enable the connection group:
segment.target: Use the following cmdlets to add and enable the connection group:

segment.source: Add-AppvClientConnectionGroup
segment.target: Add-AppvClientConnectionGroup

segment.source: Enable-AppvClientConnectionGroup
segment.target: Enable-AppvClientConnectionGroup

segment.source: Example connection group XML document with optional packages:
segment.target: Example connection group XML document with optional packages:

segment.source: Package PackageId=fc6fe0f7-be3d-4643-b37d-fc3f62d4dd5c VersionId=c67a71cd-3542-4a48-93e8-20c643c50970 DisplayName=Contoso Forms IsOptional=false
segment.target: Package PackageId=fc6fe0f7-be3d-4643-b37d-fc3f62d4dd5c VersionId=c67a71cd-3542-4a48-93e8-20c643c50970 DisplayName=Contoso Forms IsOptional=false

segment.source: Package PackageId=8f6301a5-4348-4039-9560-b27a5bb72711 VersionId=6c694b45-3e19-46c6-a327-d159aa39e1d2 DisplayName=Contoso Tax IsOptional=true
segment.target: Package PackageId=8f6301a5-4348-4039-9560-b27a5bb72711 VersionId=6c694b45-3e19-46c6-a327-d159aa39e1d2 DisplayName=Contoso Tax IsOptional=true

segment.source: Package PackageId=89d701bc-d507-4299-b6b6-000000003472 VersionId= DisplayName=Contoso Accounts IsOptional=true
segment.target: Package PackageId=89d701bc-d507-4299-b6b6-000000003472 VersionId= DisplayName=Contoso Accounts IsOptional=true

segment.source: /Packages/AppConnectionGroup
segment.target: /Packages/AppConnectionGroup

segment.source: With versions earlier than App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: With versions earlier than App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: You had to create many connection groups to make specific application and plug-in combinations available to specific users.
segment.target: You had to create many connection groups to make specific application and plug-in combinations available to specific users.

segment.source: Unpublish or delete an optional package, or unpublish an optional package and republish it later, without changing the connection group
segment.target: Unpublish or delete an optional package, or unpublish an optional package and republish it later, without changing the connection group

segment.source: Task description
segment.target: Task description

segment.source: How to perform the task
segment.target: How to perform the task

segment.source: With App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: With App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: You can unpublish, delete, or republish an optional package, which is in a connection group, without having to disable or re-enable the connection group on the App-V Client.
segment.target: You can unpublish, delete, or republish an optional package, which is in a connection group, without having to disable or re-enable the connection group on the App-V Client.

segment.source: You can also unpublish an optional package and republish it later without having to disable or republish the connection group.
segment.target: You can also unpublish an optional package and republish it later without having to disable or republish the connection group.

segment.source: Example: If you publish an optional package that contains a Microsoft Office plug-in, and you want to remove the plug-in, you can unpublish the package without having to disable the connection group.
segment.target: Example: If you publish an optional package that contains a Microsoft Office plug-in, and you want to remove the plug-in, you can unpublish the package without having to disable the connection group.

segment.source: Method
segment.target: Method

segment.source: Steps
segment.target: Steps

segment.source: App-V Server – Management Console
segment.target: App-V Server – Management Console

segment.source: To unpublish the package: In the Management Console, select elect the PACKAGES page, right-click the package that you want to unpublish, and click unpublish.
segment.target: To unpublish the package: In the Management Console, select elect the PACKAGES page, right-click the package that you want to unpublish, and click unpublish.

segment.source: To remove an optional package from a connection group: On the CONNECTION GROUPS page, select the package that you want to remove, and click the right arrow to remove the package from the connection group pane on the bottom left.
segment.target: To remove an optional package from a connection group: On the CONNECTION GROUPS page, select the package that you want to remove, and click the right arrow to remove the package from the connection group pane on the bottom left.

segment.source: App-V Client on a Stand-alone computer
segment.target: App-V Client on a Stand-alone computer

segment.source: Use the following existing cmdlets:
segment.target: Use the following existing cmdlets:

segment.source: Unpublish-AppvClientPackage
segment.target: Unpublish-AppvClientPackage

segment.source: Remove-AppvClientPackage
segment.target: Remove-AppvClientPackage

segment.source: For more information, see How to Manage App-V 5.0 Packages Running on a Stand-Alone Computer by Using PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Manage App-V 5.0 Packages Running on a Stand-Alone Computer by Using PowerShell.

segment.source: With versions earlier than App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: With versions earlier than App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: You had to:
segment.target: You had to:

segment.source: Remove the connection group from each App-V Client computer where it was enabled.
segment.target: Remove the connection group from each App-V Client computer where it was enabled.

segment.source: Unpublish the package.
segment.target: Unpublish the package.

segment.source: Remove the package from the connection group’s definition.
segment.target: Remove the package from the connection group’s definition.

segment.source: Republish the connection group.
segment.target: Republish the connection group.

segment.source: Requirements for using optional packages in connection groups
segment.target: Requirements for using optional packages in connection groups

segment.source: Review the following requirements before using optional packages in connection groups:
segment.target: Review the following requirements before using optional packages in connection groups:

segment.source: Requirement
segment.target: Requirement

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Connection groups must contain at least one non-optional package.
segment.target: Connection groups must contain at least one non-optional package.

segment.source: Check carefully that you meet this requirement, as the App-V Server and the PowerShell cmdlet don’t validate that the requirement has been met.
segment.target: Check carefully that you meet this requirement, as the App-V Server and the PowerShell cmdlet don’t validate that the requirement has been met.

segment.source: If you accidentally create a connection group that does not contain at least one non-optional package, and the end user tries to open a packaged application in that connection group, the connection group will fail.
segment.target: If you accidentally create a connection group that does not contain at least one non-optional package, and the end user tries to open a packaged application in that connection group, the connection group will fail.

segment.source: User-published connection groups can contain packages that are published globally or to the user.
segment.target: User-published connection groups can contain packages that are published globally or to the user.

segment.source: Globally published connection groups must contain only globally published packages.
segment.target: Globally published connection groups must contain only globally published packages.

segment.source: Globally published connection groups must contain packages that are published globally to ensure that the packages will be available when starting the connection group’s virtual environment.
segment.target: Globally published connection groups must contain packages that are published globally to ensure that the packages will be available when starting the connection group’s virtual environment.

segment.source: If you try to add or enable globally published connection groups that contain user-published packages, the connection group will fail.
segment.target: If you try to add or enable globally published connection groups that contain user-published packages, the connection group will fail.

segment.source: You must publish all non-optional packages before publishing the connection group that contains those packages.
segment.target: You must publish all non-optional packages before publishing the connection group that contains those packages.

segment.source: A connection group’s virtual environment cannot start if any non-optional packages are missing.
segment.target: A connection group’s virtual environment cannot start if any non-optional packages are missing.

segment.source: The App-V Client fails to add or enable a connection group if any non-optional packages have not been published.
segment.target: The App-V Client fails to add or enable a connection group if any non-optional packages have not been published.

segment.source: Before you unpublish a globally published package, ensure that the connection groups that are entitled to all the users on that computer no longer require the package.
segment.target: Before you unpublish a globally published package, ensure that the connection groups that are entitled to all the users on that computer no longer require the package.

segment.source: The system does not check whether the package is part of another user’s connection group.
segment.target: The system does not check whether the package is part of another user’s connection group.

segment.source: Unpublishing a global package will make it unavailable to every user on that computer, so make sure that each user’s connection groups no longer contain the package, or alternatively make the package optional.
segment.target: Unpublishing a global package will make it unavailable to every user on that computer, so make sure that each user’s connection groups no longer contain the package, or alternatively make the package optional.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
